segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit identifying number.
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time applying to the whole message, such as: - ultimate execution date/time
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as: - change information

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments containing a reference and constants which apply to the entire message.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message, such as: - reference to previous message - work order reference number
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time relating to the reference, such as: - order date/time (work order)

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify a party and related contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name, address, and function, such as: - message recipient - message sender - ordering customer (if different from message sender)

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to identify a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department for the party, such as: - information contact
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: SG9-SG11 A group of segments to specify containers in which goods are transported.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify container prefix and number.
RFF, A segment to provide a reference specific to the equipment, such as: - inspection number
DTM, A segment to provide a date and time relating to the equipment, such as: - inspection date/time - release date/time
LOC, A segment to provide a location relating to the equipment, such as: - place of inspection
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the container, such as: - description work item equipment (on terminal, depot or freight station)
GOR, A segment to specify a governmental requirement relating to the equipment, such as: - government procedure to be conducted
HAN, A segment to specify a handling instruction relating to the equipment, such as: - put aside for cleaning - put aside for Customs examination
MEA, A segment to specify measurements related to the equipment.
PCD, A segment to specify percentages related to the equipment such as percentage humidity.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to specify related transport details for the equipment.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to specify main carriage transport details.
DTM, A segment to specify a date and time related to transport details such as arrival and departure date and time.
RFF, A segment to provide a reference for the liner service, such as: - conference - marketing organization - syndicate - vessel sharing agreement.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to specify locations associated with the transport details.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to specify a location associated with the transport details, such as: - place of departure - place of arrival
DTM, A segment to specify date(s) and time(s) related to a location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to identify different parties/places related to the equipment.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify a related address or party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A segment group to specify contact information.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to be contacted.
COM, A segment to specify communication details of the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A segment group to identify dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to specify dangerous goods.
FTX, A segment to specify supplementary details regarding the dangerous goods such as the technical name of the dangerous goods etc.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods, such as: - net net weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A segment group to specify contact information including communication details regarding the dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to be contacted regarding the dangerous goods.
COM, A segment to specify communication details of the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A segment group to identify transport related temperature settings.

segment.documentation: TMP, A segment to specify the type of transport related temperature such as storage, transport or operating temperature and also to optionally specify a single value temperature setting.
RNG, A segment to optionally specify the transport related temperature as a range of values.
CNT, A segment to specify the number of containers in the message, explicitly given by the sender.
